subject: Learning
title: The Curse of Knowledge
description: A quick win: understand The Curse of Knowledge.

hook.text: A professor explains a concept perfectlyâ€”to herself. The students are lost. She can't understand why.

buildup.text: The curse of knowledge makes it nearly impossible to imagine not knowing what you already know.

discovery.text: Experts can't unsee their expertise. They skip steps and use jargon without realizing it.

twist.text: This is why the best learner sometimes makes a better tutor than the best expert.

climax.text: Overcoming the curse requires deliberately modeling beginner thinkingâ€”a metacognitive act itself.

punchline.text: Knowing too much can make you a worse teacher. Empathy bridges the gap.

quiz.question: What is the curse of knowledge?
options: Experts can't imagine not knowing what they know, making explanations difficult
Forgetting everything you've learned over time
A bias that only affects students, not teachers
